Dedicated to contemplation of the act of human questioning and our search for orientation within the universe, its form becomes a visual symbol of a point in space where lines converge and then diverge out again. 
   In our quest we begin by asking, What Is The Point? After that we move forward by making connections and declaring that The Point Is...
   In creating dialogue between the question and the answer, between one interpretation and another, such thoughtful actions are a testament to the human spirit's quest for meaning. It is our exploration of the transformation from doubt to understanding. In the end, the point, the meaning, and the purpose is not just a destination, but a journey.

name: The Purple-X
description: The Purple-X provides 24-hour self-service on-playa spanking installation, where we provide you with everything needed for a good spank, flog or just letting go being restrained to our fluffy purple X-cross. You can show up with a partner or pair up with a burner on the spot to take a break and carry on with your journey energized, daytime or night as you cruise the playa.

name: Any Way the Wind Blows
description: Kinetic wind art

name: My Heart Will Go On
description:
Imagine standing in the vast empty of the deep Playa, where a luminous, monumental heart radiates energy, rhythm, and warmth against the backdrop of a vibrant BRC night.

This is "My Heart Will Go On", a 10ft kinetic sculpture that dances with the rhythm of life and love, lighted up by string of LEDs, powered by the sun and wind.

Drawing inspiration from the timeless song, "My Heart Will Go On," this piece recaptures the spirit of enduring love and courage. Amid a world recovering from pandemic, a world with wars and economic downturn, it stands as a symbol of hope and resilience.

As you witness its rhythmic pulse, we hope find love: love for others, love for our shared world, and most importantly, love of yourself.

name: Café des Sables Rouges
description: A piece of a 1930s Parisian cafe got displaced through space and time and is now at Black Rock City. It's unclear how this happened. What mysteries does it hold?

name: Walk In Walker TRST
description: Finally an art project for the mobility challenged, Walk In Walker is a larger-than-life sculpture of a mobility walker. While able-bodied participants are invited to climb, there is also a wheelchair lift for those who need assistance.

name: Invisible Light of Distant Stars
description:
An observatory making visible part of the Universe that cannot directly be seen or experienced., showing the paths of Cosmic Rays whose journey began millions, even billions of years ago.

The porcupine-like exterior represents & points towards gravitational wells in deep space where Cosmic Rays spring from: the Sun; Supernovae; Active Galactic Nuclei. A detection triggers 1,000s of LEDs whose complex patterns are influenced by our collected measurements. The interior space will be surmounted by vintage star charts to showcase the Heavens. At the center is the main attraction, a Spark Chamber wherein Cosmic Rays that pass through it leave trails of ionized Neon that arcs leaving a visible trail. Invisible Light of Distant Stars made visible!
artist: Douglas Ruuska & Divide by Zero Labs

name: THE ART PARK
description: Welcome to the Art Park. The theme is abundance and the process is real. Burners are invited to explore the concept of abundance through awareness, confession and expulsion. The park is laid out taking into account the 4 directions, centered around an freestanding fireplace of burning handwritten words that reads "I still love you". Various mediums of Steele's signature signage surround the fireplace with a carefully curated selection of empowering messages on road signs and a marquee boards. There is also a series of mirrored road signs with impactful messages for endless self-reflection. The last piece of the puzzle is a "Complains Box" with a neon, a interactive way of expression and communication.

name: Let the love come down
description: Let the love come down, is an interactive piece where the painting you are laying on starts to become the emotion that the viewer is experiencing. Giving a space for people to really lay down and soak up all the beauty that is sitting just above them.

name: the Dancing Forest
description: The Dancing Forest is an enchanting, interactive playground with tilting steel poles linked by a glowing canopy of elastic web, creating a network of swaying "trees" entwined with vivid, reactive colors. Participants play, dance, swing, and balance through the installation, connecting with each other through shared, dynamic body motions. This captivating environment invites exploration and interaction, fostering a sense of unity and joy among participants.

name: Merkaba Molecule
description:
Geometry Plaza!

Three works of art inspired by geometry:  Eukaryot, Merkaba Molecule, and Hexy BattleDress work together to create a memorable landmark.

name: There Is Nothing At Burning Man
description:
This 10'x20'x5/8", 12,0000 lbs, single steel plate, sculptural text by artist MIDABI says "The Only Other Thing Is Nothing". 

It stands in the sun with subtly iridescent silver paint, large negative space, and an elongated shadow stretching across the playa. 

The meaning is complex and varied, and can be summed up in this... 

What is, is what is; the only other thing is nothing. 

Reality exists on a horizontal plane, not a vertical one. All parts of creation are equally valid and relevant. 

There is no fantasy OTHER place. This is the place. 

You're not reaching outward, through empty space, you are pressing inward, within denser space. 

There is no other anything to know. There is only becoming more familiar and intimate with what is.

name: Altar Of Oba
description: Altar of Oba is a pillar structure that pays homage to the spirit animals of the ancient Benin kingdom. It blends influences from mask making, and indigenous masquerade costumes, to create a manifestation of a multi-species being that embodies the spirits of the 3 animals that are revered in Benin cosmology - the bird of prophesy, the mud-fish, and the leopard.

name: Moomba Poomba
description:
Moomba Poomba is the offspring of Cannibal Crane another Art Installation, whom Cannibal Crane has not eaten yet. He flies and walk. His favorite meal is worms. He likes to play all day. He usually stays in a house, and he is here because he like to pulta a doomdoom. 

Moomba Poomba was created by the hand of 3 year old.

name: Wildlight Trail
description: A Mile of Lights Along the Trash Fence

name: THE ETERNAL FLAME
description: THE ETERNAL FLAME looks like a torch silver sticking out of the playa and is 5' tall. Attached to the torch on both sides is a plaque that reads: 'There is a flame that is Eternal / It burns within each of us / Even if it is not visible / It shines on!'

name: JakO Fierce
description: JakO Fierce is a 7 foot jackrabbit embodiment of a puka. He was constructed of found trash after a flood and represents what can be accomplished with the discards of our culture.

name: En mon sein, éveil bercé (In your bosom my awakening cradles)
description:
A receptacle awaits the viewer's arrival. Between the nest, the turtle shell and the boat, it is formed by the sacred geometry of the tree of life, which forms its frame and even grows as a protective branch, rounding out above the cradle.

Like the various elements it conjures, this work is intended to convey notions of protection, evolution, connection and matrix. 

The spectator can come and take shelter inside the turtle shell, the bearer of the world, just as the secrets of creation are sheltered there, according to legend.

The work invites the viewer to enter this cocoon, resting on the sheepskin that welcomes him inside the rough metal structure. The latter, often used in rites of passage, is a symbol of natural protection.

Visitors are invited to nestle into the work for refuge. Then, under the sign of protection, they can come to germinate and grow their connection to themselves and the world. 

This shelter offers protection, a break from the turmoil, a return to the source.

name: Here's Looking Through You
description:
Here's Looking Through you takes the ubiquitous "you are beautiful" sticker and turns it into a probing question and offers sage advice for better living. One side asks, "are you beautiful?" while the other side suggests "don't look high" as you stare at your own reflection. 

The piece is two 40" x 30" mirrors with vinyl lettering mounted on a wood stand. Total height is about 6 feet.

name: The Slut Altar
description: The Slut Altar is an interactive experience. The experience centers around a round platform, which is 5 ft in diameter, raised about a foot off the ground. It rotates slowly and is essentially a stage for performances, rituals, and ceremonies. The experience is emceed by the lead artist, Ginny. Music, lighting and audio will be provided by the artists' camp, where the piece will be placed (Kostume Kult - 6:45 & Esplanade). The idea  is to create  a container where participants feel safe and empowered to embody The Divine Slut within. Anyone who would like to come up to the altar will be given the opportunity to express themselves through movement for the duration of one song. While participants are performing on the altar they will get to experience being worshiped and exalted by those who are watching. There will also be electric votive candles available so that folks who would like to make an offering to the sluts on the altar will be able to light and place a candle at the altar.

name: SkyWhale: The Not Shywhale
description: The SkyWhale represents the ephemerality of nature and to break our per-concieved notions of where are can be. She is a flying whale that swims through the sky and adds a reflection of water and serenity to a landscape that is harsh and unforgiving.

name: Dead Baby Jokes Are Funny, Unless You're a Dead Baby
description: It has no meaning. But it rotates.

name: Meditation Labyrinth
description: The labyrinth is in the staff of the biological sign of a woman with one way in and one way out. The labyrinth is used for meditation and relaxation purposes.

name: Vainamal
description: three alien half body ladies into the mirror

name: Reality is Malleable
description: Participants can hit a suspended metal plate with the words "Reality is Malleable" plasma cut into it using sledge hammers.

name: Additive Reflection
description: A polished stainless steel monolith rises from the Playa. Its mirrored surface reflects the viewer and the Playa, positioned westward to maximize the position of the sunset. The monolith presents viewers with a message. This message is outlined by the colors of the sky or projected onto the Playa by the light and shadow of the setting sun. It encourages the citizens of Black Rock City to build love; to recognize that love is forged - in all its imperfections - and not found, and to love each other more tomorrow than they did today.

name: Deep Pie
description: Deep Pie is an illumuniated retrofuture pizza bar in deep playa that lures wanderers in for a hot, fresh slice and some space tunes. Here for a good time, not a long time

name: Mechanical Bull
description: Mechanical Bull is a 25% larger than life found art sculpture of a bull digging in to charge.

name: Sezacotel
description: Animating the ether, Sezacotel pays homage to the archetype of the cosmic serpent. Legendary dragons, on the wing, soaring through the cosmos. Uniting the Earth and Sky and when so inspired, sparking the Fire in its heart through breath. As the Ouroboros bites its own tail, so does this creature honor the cycles of creative destruction, death/rebirth, beginning/end. Highlighting the dance of the Universe as it ebbs & flows through time & space, Sezacotel reminds us to flow, fly & feel free!

name: PSYKCK Transducer
description: We're capturing bursts of physical effort and positive intention and directing them toward climate action.

name: Bruce the Beetle, on Blocks
description: Bruce the Beetle, On Blocks. A rescue. With the heart of a lion but the shell of a...well. You'll see.

name: The Writing Desk
description: A place to connect with yourself in the desert! Pens & paper provided.

name: Pedro The Cactus
description:
Is a nomad Art project designed to be placed in deep playa for the 2023 Animalia Burn. Brought as a walk-in art project traveling across the Atlantic all the way from the city of love, PARIS- France.

"You Get what you Give" The 1,70mts tall cactus will represent the 10 principles of the burn in some form or an other.

Inspired by the viral children's toy cactus that reproduces the sounds it is fed, The CACTUS has as purpose to inspire words and acts of kindness from each Burner in its path.
artist: The Cactus Team- Tanny Onsalo -Boris Dore - Jeremy Kenigsman

name: Blind Burners Tabletop Models
description:
Blind Burners' gallery of tabletop models includes two models of this year's Man Pavilion and the Temple of the Heart, along with Trust by Paige Tashner. The gallery also includes scale models of Ursa Minor produced by Jen Lewin, and Justice by Jenny Mount.

Participants can explore some of this year's large scale art through touch. The project was originated by Blind Burners to help Burning Man's art community to remove barriers to accessibility, and to invite participants to experience art through their more instinctive sense of touch, and challenge assumptions around art being a predominantly visual medium.
artist: 3D Printers - Anne Pauley, Micah Shapiro, Genesis, Zoltan Ferenczy, Adam Ervin. Original Artists - Temple Crew. Man Pavilion Crew. Paige Tashner. Jen Lewin. Jenny Mount

name: Growing Cosmologies
description: A "World Tree" sharing a small sampling  of the evolution of art from the paleolithic to the present, charting the change of peoples place in the natural world and prompting what for the kind of relationship we need to create.

name: FOUR HORSEPERSONS OF THE APOCALYPSE
description: Backpack performace pieces representing each of the four horsepersons of the apocalypse...war...death...famine...conquest.

name: It's a Jellyfish Day
description: A suspended mesh jellyfish with ruffly tendrils blows in the wind.

name: Rosita's Dream Vanity
description:
Our vanity doesn't have a mirror and my idea is to bring art that burners can interact with.
Normally vanities are used to get hair and makeup done and make yourself "beautifull" but since my vanity doesn't have a mirror the idea is to show burners that they do not need to see their reflection to feel beautiful.

name: David
description: Figure sculpture resembling michaelangelo's David made from tools and hardware

name: Animal Chapel
description: The structure is built out of aluminum tubing that is wrapped by black mesh netting and Burlap. The shape is an abstract representation of a bull. The visitors can enter the bull in the rear of the bull through a small slit in the fabric. Once inside there are two benches where they are invited to sit and see a large stained glass window titled "Plastic Ocean", a 75 foot long painting of a herd of mammals, and a hanging altar piece that utilizes sacred geometry.
